intro: Trichopilia tubella, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false nettle, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and a distinctive purple or reddish coloration on the underside. The plant produces small, pale blue or violet flowers that are clustered in racemes. Trichopilia tubella is native to tropical and subtropical regions and thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain ecosystems.
